feed.title: Comments on Is your Apache Server Status wide open for the world to see?
feed.subtitle: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

entry.title: By: Claude
entry.content:
While mod_status is loaded by default, it takes a special effort to activate its mapping, and a modification to expose to external traffic.

An engineer worth their salt would spend some time either compiling Apache with just the modules needed for their application or hardening the default installation (and testing it) prior to exposing it to public traffic.

This is obviously a problem for WashPo and Boston.com., but not an inherent issue in Apache.
